msContents.summary: Account for olyra, written probably by a sitologos or other official of the thesauros. Lines 1-15, headed "sperma", give a list of seed issued to or repaid by cultivators of crown or cleruchic land. Lines 17-36 give various details of expenditure for horses and other purposes. In line 37 begins a list of payments(?) to various persons from Pharmouthi to Mesore, the names of women being placed after those of men

msItem.note: Both fragments written along the fibers; on the verso, (a) plaster from mummy cartonnage, (b) plaster and design from mummy cartonnage
Cut for a chest piece of cartonnage
The hand is large and clear

Frag. (a) 2 columns: col. I, 16 lines; broken at bottom; col. II, 14 lines; broken at right and bottom; frag. (b) 2 columns: col. I, 21 lines; broken bottom and in the middle of the column is a large hole caused by cutting of cartonnage shape; col. II, 27 lines; broken except at left
